actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Committee on Judiciary requested executive comment from Justice Department.
Committee on Judiciary requested executive comment from Federal Trade Commission.
Committee on Judiciary received executive comment from Justice Department.
Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.
Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Thurmond with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. With written report No. 99-539. Additional views filed.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 1100.

official_title: A bill to amend the Newspaper Preservation Act.

summary.text: (Reported to Senate from the Committee on the Judiciary with amendment, S. Rept. 99-539) Amends the Newspaper Preservation Act to provide that a joint newspaper operating arrangement may provide for the distribution of all or part of a publication. Provides that joint conduct between the parties to a joint newspaper operating arrangement that has received a limited antitrust exemption shall not be deemed illegal per se if such conduct, although not exempt as part of such arrangement, is reasonably ancillary to the business of publishing the publications involved in the arrangement.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Newspaper Preservation Act.
